t: Mark 11
The Triumphal Entry
When*p they approached Jerusalem, at Bethphage and Bethany near the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples

and told them, “Go*r into*r the*r village*r ahead*r of*r you.*r As*r soon*r as*r you*r enter*r it,*r you*r will*r find*r a*r colt*r tied*r there,*r on*r which*r no*r one*r has*r ever*r sat.*r Untie*r it*r and*r bring*r it.*r
If*r anyone*r says*r to*r you,*r ‘Why*r are*r you*r doing*r this? ’*r say,*r ‘The*r Lord*r needs*r it*r and*r will*r send*r it*r back*r here*r right*r away.’”*r
So*p they went and found a colt outside in the street, tied by a door. They untied it,
and some of those standing there said to them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?”
They answered them just as Jesus had said; so they let them go.
They*p brought the colt to Jesus and threw their clothes on it, and he sat on it.
Many people spread their clothes on the road, and others spread leafy branches cut from the fields.
Those who went ahead and those who followed shouted: Hosanna!*ibpn Blessed*iln is*i he*i who*i comes*i in*iln the*i name*i of*i the*i Lord!*i
Blessed*ln is the coming kingdom of*ln our father David! Hosanna*ibln in the highest heaven!
He*p went into Jerusalem and into the temple. After looking around at everything, since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.
The Barren Fig Tree Is Cursed
The*p next day when they went out from Bethany, he was hungry.
Seeing in the distance a fig tree with leaves, he went to find out if there was anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for it was not the season for figs.
He said to it, “May*r no*r one*r ever*r eat*r fruit*r from*r you*r again!”*r And his disciples heard it.
Cleansing the Temple
They*p came to Jerusalem, and he went into the temple and began to throw out those buying and selling. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves,
and would not permit anyone to carry goods through the temple.

He was teaching them: “Is*r it*r not*r written,*r My*ir house*ir will*ir be*ir called*ir a*ir house*ir of*ir prayer*ir for*ir all*ir nations?*ir But*r you*r have*r made*r it*r a*ir den*ir of*ir thieves!”*ir
The*p chief priests and the scribes heard it and started looking for a way to kill him. For they were afraid of him, because the whole crowd was astonished by his teaching.
Whenever*p evening came, they would go out of the city.
The Barren Fig Tree Is Withered
Early*p in the morning, as they were passing by, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots up.
Then Peter remembered and said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered.”
Jesus*p replied to them, “Have*r faith*r in*r God.*r

Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r if*r anyone*r says*r to*r this*r mountain,*r ‘Be*r lifted*r up*r and*r thrown*r into*r the*r sea,’*r and*r does*r not*r doubt*r in*r his*r heart,*r but*r believes*r that*r what*r he*r says*r will*r happen,*r it*r will*r be*r done*r for*r him.*r
Therefore*r I*r tell*r you,*r everything*r you*r pray*r and*r ask*r for—*r believe*r that*r you*r have*r received*r it*r and*r it*r will*r be*r yours.*r

And*r whenever*r you*r stand*r praying,*r if*r you*r have*r anything*r against*r anyone,*r forgive*r him,*r so*r that*r your*r Father*r in*r heaven*r will*r also*r forgive*r you*r your*r wrongdoing.”*r
The Authority of Jesus Challenged
They*p came again to Jerusalem. As he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came
and asked him, “By what authority are you doing these things? Who gave you this authority to do these things?”
Jesus*p said to them, “I*r will*r ask*r you*r one*r question;*r then*r answer*r me,*r and*r I*r will*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.*r
Was*r John’s*r baptism*r from*r heaven*r or*r of*r human*r origin?*r Answer*r me.”*r
They*p discussed it among themselves: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
But if we say, ‘Of human origin’” — they were afraid of the crowd, because everyone thought that John was truly a prophet.
So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” And*p Jesus said to them, “Neither*r will*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.”*r
